1. Methodology
1.1 Data Sources
Primary Source: Mississippi Automated Resource Information System (MARIS) DFIRM flood hazard shapefiles
FIRM Panel Details: DFIRM panels 28035C0229E and 28035C0233E (effective date: 2011)
Secondary Sources: FEMA National Flood Hazard Layer (NFHL) web services
Parcel Data: Forrest County parcel boundaries (PPINs 26700 & 26786)
Regulatory Research: 44 CFR ยง60.3, Mississippi Administrative Code Title 33 Part 208, Hattiesburg Code Chapter 4 Articles III ยง4-26 through ยง4-35
1.2 Technical Analysis
We developed a Python-based GIS analysis script that:

Loads detailed DFIRM flood hazard data from MARIS
Performs precise geometric intersection analysis between parcels and flood zones
Generates accurate flood zone maps matching official FEMA cartography
Automates regulatory compliance assessment
Key Finding: Both target parcels (26700 & 26786) intersect Zone AE flood areas and designated floodways.

2. Regulatory Framework Analysis
2.1 Federal Regulations - 44 CFR 60.3(d)(3)
Primary Authority: Code of Federal Regulations, Title 44, Section 60.3(d)(3)

The regulation states that communities must require demonstration that proposed development will not increase the water surface elevation of the base flood more than one foot at any point within the community.

Floodway Provision: In FEMA-defined floodways, 44 CFR 60.3(d)(3) requires that proposed projects prove no-rise or 0.00-feet increase in the Base Flood Elevation (BFE).

2.2 Mississippi State Regulations
Authority: Mississippi Administrative Code, Title 33, Part 208 - Flood Damage Prevention Regulation

Regulatory Floodway Definition: "The channel of a river or other watercourse and the adjacent land areas that must be reserved in order to discharge the base flood without cumulatively increasing the water surface elevation more than one foot."
